title: Tiffany Hartwell Memorial Window Umbrella
description:
Umbrella developed from (attributed to) Agnes F. Northrop and Tiffany Studios, Hartwell Memorial Window, 1917, from the Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

The Hartwell Memorial Window is one of the most extraordinary leaded glass windows ever made by Tiffany Studios, the leading glass firm of America’s Gilded Age. Attributed to Agnes Northrop, the Hartwell Memorial Window stands 23 feet high by 16 feet wide. Made up of 48 separate panels, it is a technical marvel in the medium of glass and a work of stunning beauty.

  • Dimensions: 11 in. long when closed, 38 in. diameter when open
  • Materials: 100% polyester.
  • Auto open, close.
